title: How big is the problem of landmines and other Explosive Remnants of War (ERW) in Myanmar?
content:
-	Seven out of Myanmar’s 14 States are contaminated with landmines/ERW, and most of these landmines have been laid along border areas. 
-	Kayah State: All seven townships
-	Kayin State: All seven township
-	Kachin State: Chipwi, Mansi, Mogaung,Momauk, Myitkyina, Tsawlaw, and Waingmaw 
-	Mon State:  Bilin, Kyaikto, Mawlamyine, Thanbyuzayat, Thaton and Ye
-	Pegu division: Kyaukkyi, Shwekyin, Tantabin, Taungoo
-	Rakhine State: Maungdaw
-	Shan State: Hopong, Hsihseng, Langkho, Loilen, Mawkmai, Mongpan, Mongton, Monghpyak, Namhsan Tachileik, Namtu, Nanhkan, Yaksawk, and Ywangan 
-	Tanintharyi division: Bokpyin, Dawei, Tanintharyi, Thayetchaung and Yebyu
-	Chin state: Paletwa
-	(Karen (Kayin) state and Pegu (Bago) division are suspected heaviest mine contamination)
